text: I'm Tom Volk with driven for the new
york times this chevrolet cruze looks
just like any other considering its
mission and additional $3,000 cost you
would expect chevy to plaster it with
badges announcing that it's powered by a
turbo diesel engine this is the only
clue you might remember in the late 70s
to mid 80s General Motors had a series
of diesel engines they were awful in
fact they help give the diesel a pretty
bad reputation in America in Europe they
loved them for years the engine comes
from Germany 40 percent of European
cruise buyers go with a 2-liter turbo
diesel
it makes 151 horsepower and more
importantly 264 pound-feet of torque
the six-speed Automatic is toughened up
to handle the extra oomph punch it and
it takes a second put a hand of God
torque to come on line keep that in mind
at busy intersections passing on two
lane highways though is a kick zero to
sixty is a respectable eight and a half
seconds think modern Diesel's are dirty
no smelly ha they are much quieter now -
well kind of diesel grumble is clearly
heard in stop-and-go city driving if
you've been to Europe it'll bring back
memories up past 20 miles an hour it's
as hushed as any chevy cruze maybe more
so diesel models get even more
soundproofing the quiet cabin and
comfortable ride make for an excellent
road trip machine acclaimed range of
seven hundred and seventeen miles means
more bathroom breaks than fuel stops the
epa fuel economy figures are 27 city
which on matching driving like a normal
person and 46 highway which i am
exceeding with the cruise control locked
in at 63 miles an hour I'm seeing 49
miles per gallon so if all you want is
good city fuel economy well then go with
a hybrid freeway cruisers no pun
intended and those who enjoy driving
should check out the diesel the only
other real competitor is the Volkswagen
Jetta TDI cruise Diesel's come well
equipped at twenty five thousand seven
hundred dollars this car is a base model
so everything you see is standard yes
that includes destination yes these are
leather they're heated to the Chevy
MyLink user interface is easy to
understand the climate is manual fabric
trim on the instrument panel is unique
just so you know I am 5 foot 9 and if
for some reason I had an evil twin that
was driving I would have plenty of head
need leg and foot room back here lots of
places to stash stuff and friends can
charge their phones two adults will be
comfortable back here pack in three only
if they're well acquainted here's a
surprise the trunk of
diesel equip cruise is smaller just by a
skosh no spare either instead there's a
tank for urea fluid which scrubs the
exhaust so the diesel engine meets
emission standards in all 50 states
Canada too with a little extra
scrunching the diesel cruise scores a
six in the tipi trunk test the same as
the gas version make sure to keep a
laptop computer away from the hinge arms
though generally diesel fuel is easy to
find but more expensive math lovers will
have a field day doing the numbers and
defending which is more economical in
the long run diesel or hybrid just don't
forget driving fun in the equation the
clean turbo diesel looks like any other
cruise but offers up truck like Toro and
torque is fun
